results.title: As I Open My Eyes
results.creator_credit: Ciclic - Région Centre, Ministère des Affaires Étrangères, Centre du Cinéma et de l'Audiovisuel de la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles, VOO, Visions Sud Est, Hélicotronc, Blue Monday Productions, L'Aide aux Cinémas du Monde, Propaganda Production, Ministère Tunisien de la Culture, Moulin d'Andé-CECI, Emergence, Arab Fund for Arts and Culture, Centre national du cinéma et de l'image animée, Anthony Rey, Imed Marzouk, Leyla Bouzid, Sandra da Fonseca, Marie-Sophie Chambon, Raouf Hiloui and Nadia Anane
results.headline_credit: Belgium, France, Tunisia and United Arab Emirates, 2015
results.brief_description: As I Open My Eyes (French: À peine j’ouvre les yeux) is a 2015 French-Tunisian drama film directed by Leyla Bouzid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ciclic - Région Centre, Ministère des Affaires Étrangères, Centre du Cinéma et de l’Audiovisuel de la Fédération Wallonie-Bruxelles, VOO, Visions Sud Est, Hélicotronc, Blue Monday Productions, L’Aide aux Cinémas du Monde, Propaganda Production, Ministère Tunisien de la Culture, Moulin d’Andé-CECI, Emergence, Arab Fund for Arts and Culture, Centre national du cinéma et de l’image animée, Anthony Rey, Imed Marzouk, Leyla Bouzid, Sandra da Fonseca, Marie-Sophie Chambon, Raouf Hiloui and Nadia Anane
results.headline_credit_for_label: Belgium, France, Tunisia and United Arab Emirates, 2015
results.description: Tunis, summer 2010, a few months before the Revolution: Farah, 18 years old, has just graduated and her family already sees her as a future doctor. But she doesn’t have the same idea. She sings in a political rock band, has a passion for life, gets drunk, discovers love and her city by night against the wishes of her mother Hayet, who knows Tunisia and its dangers all too well.
description_for_label: Tunis, summer 2010, a few months before the Revolution: Farah, 18 years old, has just graduated and her family already sees her as a future doctor. But she doesn’t have the same idea. results.title: As good as it gets [Widescreen] [Captioned]
results.creator_credit: James L. Brooks, Kristi Zea, Bridget Johnson and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Melvin (Jack Nicholson) has established a regimented lifestyle which enables him to cope with his obsessive-compulsive disorder. His routine existence is interrupted by changes in the lives of his neighbour Simon (Greg Kinnear), and his waitress Carol (Helen Hunt). Caring for Simon’s dog, and his involvement in Carol’s personal life puts him back in touch with a humanity which has been lacking in his structured life. Powerful performances from Jack Nicholson and Helen Hunt, who both won Best Actor Oscars for their efforts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James L. Brooks, Kristi Zea, Bridget Johnson and Tri-Star Pictures

results.title: As girls grow up
results.brief_description: An animated film showing female growth and development, and the onset of puberty and menstruation, in a lighthearted manner. No other credits available. Suitable for Lower-Middle Secondary students.

results.title: As a matter of fact: a film about abortion
results.creator_credit: Robyn Dryen, Susan Lambert, Creative Development Branch of Australian Film Commission, Womens Film Fund and Women's Health Resources Foundation
results.brief_description: A documentary about a feminist run abortion clinic. Counselling is shown to be an important part of the procedure, which is carried out using local anaesthetic and the vacuum aspiration method. We follow one woman through the termination of her pregnancy, and other women tell why they chose to have an abortion. The film ends with an animated section on the struggle for free, legalised abortion in Australia and information on what to do and where to go if you are pregnant.

results.title: Arturo Toscanini
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of War Information and United Films
results.brief_description: Toscannini conducts the NBC Symphony Orchestra in a spirited rendition of Giuseppe Verdi’s “Hymn of the Nations”. With the Westminster Choir, featuring Jan Peerce as soloist, this performance was part of a celebration to mark the liberation of Italy during World War II. The film also sketches the life of Toscannini, showing the way in which he lived up to his convictions. No other credits available.

results.title: Arts of Japan
results.brief_description: This film tells the story of a young American who visits artists of Japan, including the painter Gyokudo Kawai, tea master Soshitsu Sen, actors Koshiro Mataumoto and Manzaburo Umewaka, potter Shoju Hamada, and wood-block artist Shiko Manakata. Includes scenes from the Noh and Kabuki dramas.

results.title: Arts in society
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Film Australia’s Australia”.
A program in which archival footage has been selected to provide students with some background on the influence of the arts in Australians’ lives.
